intro: Zeocriton vulgare, commonly known as the common zeocriton, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Zeocriton vulgare is often found in meadows and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its mild aromatic properties.
